1236-FIN.question: You want to have $8,000 in three years to purchase a car. You can earn 4% compound interest on your investment. How much should you invest today?
1236-FIN.reasoning: $7,111.75. To determine how much you should invest today, calculate the present value of your investment using the formula Present Value = Future Value / (1 + Interest Rate)Number of Years. So, the present value of your investment is equal to $8,000 / (1 + 0.04)3. To solve this equation, first add one to the interest rate (1 + 0.04 = 1.04). Next, raise this sum to the third power, which is the same as multiplying the sum by itself three times (1.043 = 1.04 X 1.04 X 1.04 = 1.1249). Finally, divide the future value of your investment by this product ($8,000 / 1.1249 = $7,111.75). To have $8,000 in three years, you need to invest $7,111.75 today. SOURCE: FI:238 Calculate the time value of money SOURCE: Study Finance. (2020). Time value of money. Retrieved September 14, 2020, from https://studyfinance.com/time-value/

1286-FIN.question: Jordan's business was highly successful last year. This year, he plans to introduce a new product line that he is certain will make his business even more profitable in the future. His financial advisor, Anna, has cautioned against taking such action because experts predict that the economy will enter a recession in the coming months. Even though Anna has warned him that expanding his business now is probably going to result in financial loss versus gain, Jordan has decided to move forward with his plans. Overconfidence is one factor that can affect a person's ability to make the right decision. Overconfident executives such as Jordan are often so sure of themselves that they can't see the risks involved in making one decision versus another, even when their colleagues warn them of possible negative consequences of their actions. Incrementalism is the diminishing of ethical values over time. Self-interest involves looking out for your own well-being, rather than making the ethical, right choice for the company and its employees. Framing is a tendency to respond to situations based on how those situations are posed or viewed. SOURCE: FI:355 Discuss the role of ethics in finance SOURCE: LAP-FI-355—Money Morals (The Role of Ethics in Finance)

1286-FIN.question: The addition of too many workers on a job may cause the marginal product to turn
1286-FIN.reasoning: Negative. The law of diminishing returns states that if all the factors of production remain the same except one, additions to the one variable factor will eventually decrease the level of productivity. If a business adds too many workers, the level of productivity will decrease and may even become negative if those workers do not have sufficient resources to function properly. A business with too many workers may end up spending more money to produce products than the products generate in income. At that point, the marginal product turns negative. The addition of too many workers does not cause the marginal product to turn upward or positive. Workers are a variable factor in production over which a business has control. SOURCE: EC:023 Explain the impact of the law of diminishing returns SOURCE: Hayes, A. (2022, April 4). Law of diminishing marginal returns. Retrieved August 10, 2023, from https://www.investopedia.com/terms/l/lawofdiminishingmarginalreturn.asp

1286-FIN.question: Which of the following is a distinguishing feature of a consolidation in the finance industry:
choices: A. All former entities no longer exist, and a single, new legal entity is formed.
B. All entities continue operating, connected by a parent-subsidiary relationship.
C. The acquirer does not have to purchase 100% of the target company's equity.
D. One of the entities continues to exist, absorbing 100% of another entity's stock.

A consolidation occurs when two businesses agree to create a new entity so that one business can take over the net assets of another entity; neither of the original entities continues to exist. After an acquisition, all entities continue operating, connected by a parent-subsidiary relationship. A merger occurs when a business absorbs 100% of another entity's stock and the acquirer continues to exist. In a consolidation, the acquirer purchases 100% of the target's equity, not less. 9360-FIN.question: What should a bank teller do if a customer disputes a charge for overdrawing a checking account?

9360-FIN.question: A business that analyzes a customer's income and employment status before granting credit is considering the customer's
9360-FIN.reasoning: Capacity to pay. 9360-FIN.question: When a business's insurance premiums are high, it is most often because the

9360-FIN.question: What do businesses often need to do in order to continue operating if they experience negative cash flow?

9360-FIN.question: Which of the following might maximize wealth on a long-term basis while reducing short-term profit:

9360-FIN.question: An investor buys 100 shares of the ABC Corporation for $14 per share because a financial analyst predicted that the stock would triple in value in two years. If that prediction is true, what will the shares be worth at that time?

9360-FIN.question: Determining the optimal capital budget is important to businesses because the funds in this budget are for

9360-FIN.question: A business evaluating the cost of purchasing certain assets in the hope that these assets will have significantly more value in the future is an example of assessing

9360-FIN.question: The business function that determines what funds the company needs is

9360-FIN.question: One reason why many businesses conduct a trend analysis is to compare their financial ratios with

9360-FIN.question: Leverage refers to the amount of debt used to finance a firm's assets. Using the debt-to-equity ratio, determine how much a company with total liabilities of $5,320,000 and total stockholders' equity of $17,767,000 is leveraged.

9360-FIN.question: How do businesses often plan to use an excess of cash?

9360-FIN.question: It is helpful to a small business to factor accounts receivable when

9360-FIN.question: Imagine an inventory with just four items. The two items purchased first cost $1,000 each, the third item cost $2,000, and the fourth item cost $3,000. 9360-FIN.question: One reason why some small business owners decide to obtain additional capital by taking out a home equity loan is because

9360-FIN.question: When allocating funds among projects/uses, businesses consider the length of time it will take to regain their money, which is known as the

9360-FIN.question: The only revenues and expenses that are relevant to short-term decisions made by managers are those that

9360-FIN.question: Stating each item on an income statement as a dollar amount as well as a percentage of sales is an example of __________ analysis.

9360-FIN.question: You've just won the lottery! You have to choose between receiving $10,000 today or $50,000 in twenty years. Using a present value table, you find that the present value of $1 received 20 years from now with an interest rate of 10% is .149. What is the present value of the $50,000?
choices: A.	Approximately $10,000, depending on the form of the payments
9360-FIN.reasoning: Less than $10,000. When determining the present value of money received in the future, the dollar amount of the money is multiplied by the value that corresponds to the available interest rate (also called the discount rate or cost of capital) and number of periods on a present value table. As noted above, the value for 20 years at 10% is .149. The present value of that $50,000 is $7,450 ($50,000 x .149 = $7,450), which is less than $10,000. SOURCE:	FI:238 SOURCE:	Shim, J.K., & Siegel, J.G. (2000). Financial management (2nd ed.) [pp. 101-102, 111]. Hauppauge, NY: Barron's.

9360-FIN.question: What is the current yield on a $1,000 par value bond with a 14% coupon rate that is selling for $1,200?
9360-FIN.reasoning: 11.7%. A bond's current yield is the annual interest payment divided by the current price of the bond. The annual interest payment on a $1,000 bond with a 14% coupon rate is $140. Calculate this amount by multiplying the value of the bond by the coupon rate ($1,000 x 14% or .14 = $140). Then, divide that amount by the current price to determine the current yield of 11.7% ($140 ÷ $1,200 = .11666 or .117 or 11.7%). SOURCE:	FI:240 SOURCE:	Shim, J.K., & Siegel, J.G. (2000). Financial management (2nd ed.) [p. 130]. Hauppauge, NY: Barron's.

9360-FIN.question: What is the annual percentage rate of an investment that pays 8%, compounded quarterly?
9360-FIN.reasoning: 8.24%. Annual percentage rate (APR) is calculated with the formula [1 + (I ÷ m)]m - 1, where I equals the stated interest rate and m equals the number of compounding periods per year. In this example, the interest rate is 8% and is compounded four (4) times a year. An investment that pays 8%, compounded quarterly is calculated thus: APR = [1 + (.08 ÷ 4)]4 - 1;= [1+ .02] 4 - 1;= 1.0824 - 1;= .0824 or 8.24%. SOURCE:	FI:244 SOURCE:	Shim, J.K., & Siegel, J.G. (2000). Financial management (2nd ed.) [pp. 106-107]. Hauppauge, NY: Barron's.

9360-FIN.question: What is the standard deviation for a security with a variance of 144?

SOURCE:	FI:247 SOURCE:	Shim, J.K., & Siegel, J.G. (2000). Financial management (2nd ed.) [p. 121]. Hauppauge, NY: Barron's.

9360-FIN.question: Which of the following forms of business structure is subject to "double taxation":

9360-FIN.question: The main purpose of a stable dividend policy is to

9360-FIN.question: Why do businesses routinely screen job applications and resumes?

9360-FIN.question: The type of training that allows an employee to learn several related jobs, one at a time, until the training process has been completed, is known as

9360-FIN.question: One possible disadvantage of rewarding employees for performing certain activities is that some employees will
choices: A.	look for ways to avoid doing the work.

Management fundamentals: Concepts, applications, skill development (2nd ed.) [pp. 250-251]. Mason, OH: South-Western.

9360-FIN.question: What action should a manager take first in response to an employee's complaint that s/he has been scheduled to work on a day s/he had expected to have free?
choices: A.	Set a specific time to give the employee a decision.

9360-FIN.question: Which of the following should be done first when developing an employee evaluation procedure:

9360-FIN.question: What process involves all of the planning, pricing, promoting, and distributing activities that must take place in order to get goods and services to the consumer?

9360-FIN.question: When creating your business's web page, you make it possible for Internet browsers to identify and locate various elements of your page through the proper placement of
9360-FIN.reasoning: Meta tags. Meta tags are HTML codes that display information about web pages. HTML, or Hypertext Markup Language, is the program used for creating pages on the World Wide Web. 9360-FIN.question: Most businesses maintain records about what customers are buying and how much they are spending in order to
9360-FIN.reasoning: Analyze the information. Most businesses maintain customer records that contain information about what customers are buying, when they are buying, and how much they are spending. By analyzing this information, businesses are able to plan future sales and obtain the products that will appeal to customers and encourage them to buy. Without this type of information, businesses might have no idea what customers will want to buy in the future, or how much they will be willing to spend. 9360-FIN.question: One reason for a business to monitor its internal records is to obtain information that it can use to
choices: B.	track the activities of its competitors.

9360-FIN.reasoning: Make decisions about future operations. Companies keep many types of internal records about their various business activities. These records might contain information about sales, agreements with vendors, financial status, etc. Management and employees use the records to make decisions about day-to-day and future actions. For example, records that indicate that sales are increasing and the company is profitable might encourage the business to decide to expand. Monitoring internal records does not help a business to track the activities of competitors or understand global economic conditions. 9360-FIN.question: What does the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) require all companies to have available for use?
9360-FIN.reasoning: Adequate first-aid supplies. The Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) requires companies of all sizes to have adequate first-aid supplies available for use. Employees should find out where these supplies are located before an accident has the chance to happen. It would also be beneficial for employees to know how to use the first-aid supplies. OSHA does not require companies to have back-up power sources, replacement office equipment, or emergency generator units. SOURCE:	OP:009 SOURCE:	RM LAP 3—Handling Accidents

9360-FIN.question: According to recent studies, what are the most effective deterrents to shoplifting?

SOURCE:	OP:013 SOURCE:	Berman, B., & Evans, J.R. (1998). Retail management: A strategic approach (7th ed.) [pp. 415-417]. Upper Saddle River, NJ: Prentice Hall.

9360-FIN.question: Purchasing is important to international businesses because
choices: A.	quality standards should be maintained.

9360-FIN.question: Kenny broke his leg playing soccer. He was taken to the emergency room where his leg was examined and put into a cast by a doctor. The process of getting Kenny's leg back to normal is known as

9360-FIN.question: Calculate a business's gross profit if it had sales of $370,500, fixed costs of $115,200, $500 in charitable donations, and spent $135,750 on cost of goods sold.
9360-FIN.reasoning: $234,750. Gross profit results from the subtraction of cost of goods sold from total revenue. 9360-FIN.question: Which of the following actions by employees might result in additional expense for a business:

SOURCE:	OP:025 SOURCE:	MN LAP 56—Employee Role in Expense Control

9360-FIN.question: To control payroll expenses, a business hires four part-time employees to work 20 hours each week for $11.50 an hour rather than two full-time employees at a salary of $575 each per week. Calculate the amount  the business will save during a two-week pay period.
9360-FIN.reasoning: $460. Many businesses control expenses by hiring part-time employees at an hourly rate instead of salaried, full-time employees. The advantage to the business is the same number of employees working during a given time period but for less wages. To calculate the savings, first determine the weekly payroll expense for one part-time employee by multiplying the number of hours worked each week by the hourly rate ($11.50 x 20 =$230). Then, multiply that amount by the four part-time employees ($230 x 4 = $920); and the total weekly amount by the two-week pay period ($920 x 2 = $1,840). Next, determine what the payroll would be for two full-time employees by multiplying the weekly salary by the number of employees and that amount by the two-week pay period ($575 x 2 = $1,150; $1,150 x 2 = $2,300). Then, subtract the two-week, part-time payroll from the two-week, full-time payroll to determine the amount the business will save ($2,300 - $1,840 = $460). SOURCE:	OP:029 SOURCE:	BizMove.com. (n.d.). How to reduce costs. Retrieved August 28, 2007, from http://www.bizmove.com/finance/m3k.htm

9360-FIN.question: The job interviewer told Elizabeth at the end of the interview that he couldn't offer her the job because she lacked a particular skill that the job required. Elizabeth's next step should be to

9360-FIN.question: Two common methods for locating a professional organization/association that satisfies the needs of a prospective member are

9360-FIN.question: What should the salesperson do when s/he is helping a customer and another customer enters the selling area?

9360-FIN.question: Which of the following are responsible for the overall operation of a business:

9360-FIN.question: Why is it important for managers to develop standards to measure the productivity of specific business activities?

9360-FIN.question: Intermediaries are among the environmental factors that affect a business's planning because intermediaries are responsible for

1167-ENT-DISTRICT.question: What requirement of a legally enforceable contract requires that both of the parties who are entering into the contract are sane, sober, and of legal age?

1167-ENT-DISTRICT.question: A manufacturer of dishwashing soap has just invented a new type of soap that cleans better. The manufacturer should choose to distribute the soap through __________ distribution.

choices: A. its poor performance will negatively impact its partners' image.

C. it is no longer adding value to the products it is selling.
D. consumers prefer buying products from successful stores.

One store's poor performance will not necessarily harm the image of its channel partners. It is not necessarily true that consumers prefer buying products from successful stores. 2019-ENT-ICDC.question: Will is ready to take a step back from ownership of his business, but he still wants to remain involved. Will should

2019-ENT-ICDC.question: A customer slips on a wet floor and breaks her leg while in Patti's home-based cooking business. What type of insurance coverage should Patti have that would pay the customer's medical costs?

2019-ENT-ICDC.question: At the beginning of each fiscal year, Jessica analyzes financial information and performs calculations to help her business determine its financial goals (such as what to sell and how much to sell). Jessica is engaging in

2019-ENT-ICDC.question: Steve is 60 years old and has retired from a job after 30 years working at a tree farm. Steve has always dreamed of running a small orchard and fruit farm. If his business fails, what type of funding carries the most personal financial risk to Steve's future?

A business partner reduces financial risk by sharing funds and responsibility for a business's success or failure. 2019-ENT-ICDC.question: The ADKAR model, which stands for Awareness, Desire, Knowledge, Ability, and Reinforcement, is a strategy that businesses use for

2019-ENT-ICDC.question: Sarah is applying for a business loan to finance some new equipment for her business. Why should Sarah review the business's current cash flow before calculating the actual loan amount to request?

2019-ENT-ICDC.question: Which of the following is a benefit of debt financing when starting a business:

2019-ENT-ICDC.question: Which of the following ratios can help a business determine its overall profitability:

A liquidity ratio measures a company's ability to pay off its short-term debts. A working capital ratio is a type of liquidity ratio. A dividend yield is a type of market prospect ratio. 2019-ENT-ICDC.question: The Ace Company's number one business priority is to develop confident and capable employees who can provide expert customer assistance. 2019-ENT-ICDC.question: Liam has complained to his manager, Renee, that he can't complete his reports on time because the accounting department has not updated data that he needs. How should Renee respond to Liam's complaint?
choices: A. Tell him to report the situation to a staff member in upper management

2019-ENT-ICDC.question: A company is drafting a budget for a new product it intends to sell. The data that it includes in this new product's budget are most likely to be

Facts are data that can be verified. There's no disputing that a fact is true. However, budgets do not contain facts because they are used to make predictions and estimates about the future—and nobody knows exactly what the future holds! 2019-ENT-ICDC.question: Gabrielle used to own the only coffee shop in her neighborhood, but another shop just opened up down the street. This competition is considered a

2019-ENT-ICDC.question: A company needs to forecast sales for its yearly marketing plan. The business decides to use a type of forecasting in which several experts are asked for their opinions. In other words, the business is utilizing the __________ method of sales forecasting.

2019-ENT-ICDC.question: Brian is developing a customer profile for his new dog-sitting company's target market. Which of the following questions is most relevant for developing his customer profile:

2019-ENT-ICDC.question: A retail store tracks the number of customers that open the company's promotional emails and/or visit its website. The company uses these data to measure its marketing performance. Which of the following marketing metrics is the company using:

2019-ENT-ICDC.question: Why is it important for a business's stored business records to be accurate?

2022-ENT-ICDC.question: Which of the following statements best describes a formally solicited business proposal:
choices: A. It is written when there isn't a request for a proposal.
B. It is written when there is a request for a proposal.
C. It is created out of informal conversations.
D. It is taking a generic, one-size-fits-all approach.
2022-ENT-ICDC.reasoning: It is written when there is a request for a proposal. A business proposal is a formal document created by a company that is shared with a prospect with the goal of locking in a business agreement. The three types of business proposals are formally solicited, informally solicited, and unsolicited. Formally solicited business proposals are made when a business responds to an official request to write a business proposal. With formally solicited business proposals, all of the requirements are known, and you know most or all of the information about the potential buyer—you simply need to write a business proposal for the buyer to review to begin the sales process. An informally solicited business proposal is written when there isn't an official request for a proposal. Rather, it is the result of informal conversations. Unsolicited business proposals take a generic, one-size-fits-all approach to business proposals and are similar to marketing brochures or cold emails. Unsolicited business proposals lack an understanding of the buyer or their requirements. SOURCE: CO:062 SOURCE: Sheth, A. (2021, November 24). How to write a business proposal (Examples & templates). 2022-ENT-ICDC.question: Which of the following is an impact of implementing an effective customer profile system into a marketing and sales campaign:

B. It increases the price of a campaign.
C. It creates a broader customer base.

2022-ENT-ICDC.question: If a manager is focused on helping their staff recognize the need for change and raising awareness of various challenges facing the organization, what step of the change management process are they displaying?

2022-ENT-ICDC.question: Prior to her business's grand opening, Angela had fire sprinklers, fire extinguishers, fire safety exit signs, and smoke alarms installed throughout the building. The installation of these fire safety measures is an example of which common risk response?

SAMPLE-ENT-SAMPLE.question: One of the main reasons why owners develop a business plan before starting a new business is to

SAMPLE-ENT-SAMPLE.question: To prevent viruses and spyware from infecting his business's computer network, Chuck built a network firewall. Chuck acted
SAMPLE-ENT-SAMPLE.reasoning: Proactively. SAMPLE-ENT-SAMPLE.question: The SQZ Company uses a computer application that allows managers to view the number of callers that are currently in queue and waiting for a customer-service representative to help them. This is an example of a
SAMPLE-ENT-SAMPLE.reasoning: Dashboard. Dashboards are technology applications that allow management to view and evaluate a process or activity as it occurs. SAMPLE-ENT-SAMPLE.question: Some general guidelines for creating a successful business plan include making the plan clear and concise, making the plan focused, and making the plan
SAMPLE-ENT-SAMPLE.reasoning: Realistic. A business plan should be clear, concise, focused, realistic, and accurate with a logical structure and flow. Each section should begin with a short summary.
